channel.title: God Said What?
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons License - Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike - http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/
channel.description: A radio program bringing scripture to life with insights into daily life, our transgressions and inspirations for sinners seeking the path to the Lord. More information is available at www.samuelphilemon.com This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com
channel.itunes:author: Samuel Philemon
channel.itunes:subtitle: God Said What?
channel.itunes:summary: A radio program bringing scripture to life with insights into daily life, our transgressions and inspirations for sinners seeking the path to the Lord. More information is available at www.samuelphilemon.com This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com

item.title: He said, "Enter the Vineyard"
item.author: samuel.philemon@samuelphilemon.com
item.description: Samuel Philemon welcomes special guest Paul Foulett of the South Las Vegas New Life Ministry. Passages from Isaiah and Mathew reveal paths to righteousness for the wicked.
item.itunes:author: Samuel Philemon
item.itunes:subtitle: He said, "Enter the Vineyard"
item.itunes:summary: Samuel Philemon welcomes special guest Paul Foulett of the South Las Vegas New Life Ministry. Passages from Isaiah and Mathew reveal paths to righteousness for the wicked.
item.itunes:keywords: Bible, Christ, church, cathedral, house of worship, Demon, Evangelical, evangelist, deity, Spirit, divinity, supernatural being, God, rapture, heaven, hell, Jesus, cleric, vicar, rector, parson, monk,

item.title: He Said, "Save a Wh**e"
item.author: samuel.philemon@samuelphilemon.com
item.description: From Sin City, Samuel broadcasts live and brings the message of reconciliation. Drawing from Romans and Hosea, Samuel outlines his crusade for saving whores and those around them that commit sin.
item.itunes:author: Samuel Philemon
item.itunes:subtitle: He Said, "Save a Wh**e"
item.itunes:summary: From Sin City, Samuel broadcasts live and brings the message of reconciliation. Drawing from Romans and Hosea, Samuel outlines his crusade for saving whores and those around them that commit sin.
item.itunes:keywords: Bible, Christ, church, cathedral, house of worship, Demon, Evangelical, evangelist, deity, Spirit, divinity, supernatural being, God, rapture, heaven, hell, Jesus, cleric, vicar, rector, parson, monk,

item.title: He said, "Save the Prostitute"
item.author: samuel.philemon@samuelphilemon.com
item.description: Scripture is shared with Samuel which makes him aware of the need to minister to those that have heart's burning with passion.
item.itunes:author: Samuel Philemon
item.itunes:subtitle: He said, "Save the Prostitute"
item.itunes:summary: Scripture is shared with Samuel which makes him aware of the need to minister to those that have heart's burning with passion.

item.title: He Said, "Be Not the Footstool."
item.author: samuel.philemon@samuelphilemon.com
item.description: Samuel emerges from the ashes of despair and shares words of encouragement and courage from Jeremiah and Isaiah.
item.itunes:author: Samuel Philemon
item.itunes:subtitle: He Said, "Be Not the Footstool."
item.itunes:summary: Samuel emerges from the ashes of despair and shares words of encouragement and courage from Jeremiah and Isaiah.
item.itunes:keywords: Bible, Christ, church, cathedral, house of worship, Demon, Evangelical, evangelist, deity, Spirit, divinity, supernatural being, God, rapture, heaven, hell, Jesus, cleric, vicar, rector, parson, monk,

item.title: He said, "Stand for Love"
item.author: samuel.philemon@samuelphilemon.com
item.description: Although beaten, Samuel finds the courage to share scripture from the Book of Samuel and Job. His stand for Love is an encouragement for all of us to speak the Word of God.
item.itunes:author: Samuel Philemon
item.itunes:subtitle: He said, "Stand for Love"
item.itunes:summary: Although beaten, Samuel finds the courage to share scripture from the Book of Samuel and Job. His stand for Love is an encouragement for all of us to speak the Word of God.
item.itunes:keywords: Bible, Christ, church, cathedral, house of worship, Demon, Evangelical, evangelist, deity, Spirit, divinity, supernatural being, God, rapture, heaven, hell, Jesus, cleric, vicar, rector, parson, monk,

item.title: He Said, "Be Not the Lion."
item.author: samuel.philemon@samuelphilemon.com
item.description: Samuel shares how bringing the Word of God to the dechurched demands that we seek out the scorned of society. By sharing the Word of God we can save the world one soul at a time.
item.itunes:author: Samuel Philemon
item.itunes:subtitle: He Said, "Be Not the Lion."
item.itunes:summary: Samuel shares how bringing the Word of God to the dechurched demands that we seek out the scorned of society. By sharing the Word of God we can save the world one soul at a time.
item.itunes:keywords: Bible, Christ, church, cathedral, house of worship, Demon, Evangelical, evangelist, deity, Spirit, divinity, supernatural being, God, rapture, heaven, hell, Jesus, cleric, vicar, rector, parson, monk,

item.title: He Said, "Karma is not Christian!"
item.author: samuel.philemon@samuelphilemon.com
item.description: To teach a different understanding of salvation is heresy. Christianity teaches that salvation is completely a gift of God's grace in Christ received by faith. Samuel shares passages from Ephesians and Isiah.
item.itunes:author: Samuel Philemon
item.itunes:subtitle: He Said, "Karma is not Christian!"
item.itunes:summary: To teach a different understanding of salvation is heresy. Christianity teaches that salvation is completely a gift of God's grace in Christ received by faith. Samuel shares passages from Ephesians and Isiah.
item.itunes:keywords: Bible, Christ, church, cathedral, house of worship, Demon, Evangelical, evangelist, deity, Spirit, divinity, supernatural being, God, rapture, heaven, hell, Jesus, cleric, vicar, rector, parson, monk,

item.title: He said, "Come Back to Your Senses."
item.author: samuel.philemon@samuelphilemon.com
item.description: In today's episode Samuel Philemon calls us to share the Word of God with our fellow man on a daily basis.
item.itunes:author: Samuel Philemon
item.itunes:subtitle: He said, "Come Back to Your Senses."

item.title: He said, "Be not Judas!"
item.author: samuel.philemon@samuelphilemon.com
item.description: Samuel brings together the passages of Acts and Jeremiah to help us distinguish between being Judas and drinking from the Lord's cup of wrath.
item.itunes:author: Samuel Philemon
item.itunes:subtitle: He said, "Be not Judas!"
item.itunes:summary: Samuel brings together the passages of Acts and Jeremiah to help us distinguish between being Judas and drinking from the Lord's cup of wrath.

item.title: He said, "Have Righteous Goals!"
item.author: samuel.philemon@samuelphilemon.com
item.description: From the streets of downtown San Francisco, Samuel Philemon brings the word of God to those around him.

item.title: He said, "Don't Sin!"
item.author: samuel.philemon@samuelphilemon.com
item.description: Passages from Timothy and Peter share insight into God's desire for us not to sin.
